entries.meaning: (aviation) The rapid, uncontrollable descent of an aircraft in a steep spiral.
examples: The loss of the third engine threw the plane into a tailspin.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) A severe mental or emotional collapse; emotional breakdown.
examples: Just hours after leaving the institution, she suffered another tailspin.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Any sharp, sustained, often uncontrollable descent or decline.
examples: The present stock tailspin proves bankruptcy is imminent.

verbs.description: tailspin (third-person singular simple present tailspins, present participle tailspinning, simple past and past participle tailspun or tailspinned)

entries.meaning: Of an aircraft: to go into a rapid, uncontrollable descent in a steep spiral.
(figurative) To go into a sharp, sustained, often uncontrollable descent or decline.
